subnotes.content: The photographs have also been microfilmed in their original location in the files.

Photographs accompanying collection material and audio cassette tapes representing certain oral history interviews comprise this series.

Interviews were conducted with eleven members of the council, who served terms between 1951 and 1955. These interviews provide a perspective of the post-WWII Foundation and the development of the organization after the acceptance of the Belding funds. This historical information was intended to supplement the Foundation's narrative history written by Alice FitzGerald.
 
The taped interviews are with Emily McFarland, April 26-27, 1994 (2 cassette tapes); Kathleen Mortimer, April 14, 1994 (1 cassette tape); and George Wheatley, April 14, 1994 (1 cassette tape).  There are also two reels of magnetic tape concerning the Foundation's Seventy-Fifth Anniversary, February 4, 1975, and its Annual Meeting, September 28, 1979.

Brittle or damaged items, or materials otherwise in need of preservation care, may be closed to researchers at the discretion of the RAC Head of Archival Services/Head of Reference.  The oral history interviews on four audio cassettes are fragile and are not available for playback.

Permission is required to cite, quote from, or reproduce any portion of the Oral History interviews. For copyright information and permission, please contact the Columbia Center for Oral History, Columbia University.
Materials requiring specialized equipment for access (audio) may be closed to research dependent on availability of the applicable equipment.
